title: bootstrap: index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1', src/librustc_metadata/rmeta/decoder.rs:341:61

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
This happened while bootstrapping `std`, rustc @ 7e11379f3b4c376fbb9a6c4d44f3286ccc28d149 ### Error output ``` Building stage1 std artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Compiling std v0.0.0 (/home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/src/libstd) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1', src/librustc_metadata/rmeta/decoder.rs:341:61 ```

x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.19s Copying stage0 std from stage0 (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Building x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Assembling stage1 compiler (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Building stage1 std artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
